summary: This document is an email chain between FBI agents discussing volunteer assistance for the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation. It reveals internal FBI coordination seeking help with evidence preparation, organization, and review for discovery purposes.

events.title: Volunteer offer for Epstein/Maxwell investigation
events.description: An FBI agent emails expressing interest in assisting with the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation and offers to help with evidence preparation and review.

events.title: Follow-up request to discuss volunteer assistance
events.description: Follow-up email requesting to schedule a time to chat about volunteer assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively seeking volunteer assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation as of July 2020.
Volunteer work involved preparing and organizing evidence for discovery, reviewing items, and listening to recordings.
The investigation was being handled by the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad (C-20) at the FBI New York Field Office.
This email chain shows internal FBI coordination for a high-profile case.
The document references both Epstein and Maxwell investigations as ongoing in mid-2020.
